required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence of H. Pylori Gastritis in Sleeve Gastrectomy Specimens
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence of H. Pylori Gastritis in Sleeve Gastrectomy Specimens: A Cross-Sectional

brief_summary.textblock: This is a cross-sectional study looking for prevalence of H.Pylori related gastritis among patients underwent sleeve gastrectomy over five year study period. The study also looks for possible association with patients's characteristics. Also, compares its findings with similar regional and international studies.

primary_outcome.time_frame: start to end of the study, 5 years
primary_outcome.description: proportion of patients who underwent sleeve gastrectomy who have gastritis in their resected gastric specimen at or during study period. calculated as (number of pt with gastritis / number of examined resected gastric specimens)

primary_outcome.time_frame: start to end of the study, 5 years
primary_outcome.description: proportion of patients who underwent sleeve gastrectomy who have H.pylori related gastritis in their resected gastric specimen at or during study period. calculated as (number of pt with H.pylori gastritis / number of examined resected gastric specimens)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: start to end of the study, 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: proportion of patients who underwent sleeve gastrectomy who have histopathological findings not including gastritis or H.pylori related gastritis in their resected gastric specimen at or during study period. calculated as (number of pt with the histopathological finding / number of examined resected gastric specimens)

secondary_outcome.measure: likelihood ratio between H.pylori gastritis and advancing age
secondary_outcome.time_frame: start to end of the study, 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: The relationship between H.pylori gastritis and advancing age. likelihood ratio will be calculated by cross table analysis using Statistical Analysis Software SPSS program version 26.

secondary_outcome.measure: likelihood ratio between H.pylori gastritis and female gender
secondary_outcome.time_frame: start to end of the study, 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: The relationship between H.pylori gastritis and female gender. likelihood ratio will be calculated by cross table analysis using Statistical Analysis Software SPSS program version 26.

secondary_outcome.measure: likelihood ratio between H.pylori gastritis and BMI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: start to end of the study, 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: The relationship between H.pylori gastritis and body mass index (BMI). weight and height will be combined to report BMI in kg/m^2 likelihood ratio will be calculated by cross table analysis looking for using Statistical Analysis Software SPSS program version 26.

arm_group.description: Patients who underwent sleeve gastrectomy and the histopathology result of resected gastric specimen showed the presence of gastritis in it.

intervention.description: Giemsa special stain was employed for detection of H. Pylori microorganisms.

study_pop.textblock: Obese patients who undergo sleeve gastrectomy for bariatric reasons

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients who underwent sleeve gastrectomy
- surgery was performed between January 2015 and October 2019
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients whose resected specimens were not examined histopathologically

patient_data.ipd_description: We are not willing to share study data due to hospital policies, but data is available for interested researchers upon request after verification and masking through corresponding author.
